title: Champion Insights: Kled, the Noxian Meme

replies.body:
So excited to play this guy! Love the counter-personalities of Kled and Skaarl. 

Also pretty interesting about the Kilroy thing. Did you guys come up with that for this article or was it an initial guiding idea?

Kilroy was actually a tag used by GIs to indicate where they had been.  It was commonly used to indicate structures that had been cleared previously, what direction troops were headed, etc.  It is a rich part of our history abroad and a testament to American ingenuity.

There is one story that I like even better from WWII - as Nazi German soldiers were notorious for having nit-picky perfectionist personalities, many GIs would rig explosives to paintings in homes and structures, and then cock the painting to the side.  The German soldiers, unable to control their better instincts, would straighten the painting, and KABLAMMO!  If you go into the home of many WWII vets you are very likely to still find crooked paintings in their homes, a subtle reminder of their former battlefield aptitude.

And that concludes today's history lesson lol
logged in to up vote this
The narrative writer, WAAARGHbobo, was inspired by it while writing Kled's lore.

I remember reading something that the Kilroy image and the name were actually two separate memes. Soldiers have been signing shit for centuries, "X was here" is crazy common (Vikings did it!). But at some point, some fledgling memelord named Kilroy wrote his name beneath that picture and the combo meme went viral "af" as the kids say.

Thank you, this really helps us understand how the champ creation process works. Its almost like we're stting in your studio observing you guys creating this guy from scratch. 

Means a lot - keep it up pal. Well not you specifically. but you know. In general.  You keep writing funny comments in random posts, let the real writers handle the narration (kappa) {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I really appreciate it! I think we could probably do more to let you guys in on the champ creation process—the reason we haven't done more so far is because it's actually generally pretty messy. 

Like, these insights pieces might make it seem like it was a pretty clean, linear process, but in reality it takes a super long time and we go down a lot of dead-end streets while we're making them. 

When I write these pieces, I try to just extract the most interesting ideas and stories from the dev teams. I sit down with them for lunch or whatever, and we do a pretty lengthy interview that I record using my phone. I try to ask any questions that I think players would find interesting. Then, if you guys have any other questions here in the comments, I can go try to find the answers for you!

Do you have a background in journalism? I studied journalism and ended up in the nonprofit industry instead, but I always like reading your stuff as it feels like some of the most professional and put-together feature writing in the world of League content. You have a good eye for stories, one that seems like it'd come from studying journalism.

Your kind words have made happy feelings fill my inside parts.

Yes, I went to school for journalism. University of Mississippi represent, hotty toddy, all that. I also worked as a features writer for magazines like Wired, Edge, and GamePro for a long time before I crossed over to work in the games industry. 

A lot of people who study journalism end up doing different stuff these days... there's just not a market for it, unfortunately.
